data.event: In 1291 the estate was divided into three and Middleton was held by the de Frevilles.
When Margaret died in 1493 she left the estate to her grandson (by her first marriage) Sir Henry Willughby.
Ornithologist Francis Willughby was born there in 1635.
It stayed in the family until 1924.

event.title: the late 1970s Middleton Hall and the surrounding estate came

data.event: By the late 1970s Middleton Hall and the surrounding estate came under the ownership of the Amey Roadstone Construction (ARC) for sand and gravel extraction.

event.title: the establishment of the Middleton Hall Trust in 1980

data.event: It was saved by the establishment of the Middleton Hall Trust in 1980, a group of volunteers who are restoring the Hall with the help of local authorities and national bodies.
